DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the accuracy of SPINESCAN® with standard lateral x-rays of the spine in patients monitored for kyphosis.
DOC.detailed_description: Kyphosis is usually a developmental deformity of the spine in the sagittal plane. Once diagnosed, serial X-rays are used for followup. These are usually required at yearly intervals. SPINESCAN® is a computerized digital inclinometer, design for evaluating angular spine deformities. Patients examined in the spine clinic with recent X-rays will be examined with SPINESCAN® and it's results compared with the classical radiological assessment.
DOC.criteria: Patients examined in scoliosis clinic for kyphosis with recent lateral spine Xrays. Age: 7 years old and above. Less than 7 years old. No informed consent.
